result.execSummary:
The defendant John paul Majerus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Release date April 29, 2019 with good time.
Concurrent with: Illinois sentence.

Money held by Pierce County Sheriff's Department to be used to pay court costs.
Any property and remaining money being held by the Pierce County Sheriff's Department (after court costs of $443 is paid to the Clerk of Courts office) shall be turned over to the person Mr Majerus has chosen to retrieve his belongings.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John paul Majerus

records.addlTxt: Court costs were paid in full by Prescott Police Department from funds held in evidence.

09:12 AM Defendant John paul Majerus in court, in custody in Illinois.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John paul Majerus appeared by video means. Sticht: Def will plea guilty to amended charge possession of THC. Asks for 30 days jail and court costs.  Court goes over the Defendant's right to be present in Court, waiver of right to attorney and plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to be present in court and right to an attorney. Def pleas guilty to amended charge of possession of THC. (Atty Sticht will prepare an information); stipulates to facts in the criminal complaint.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of amended charge of possession of THC. Atty Sticht addresses sentencing; requests warrant be quashed.  Asks the money seized during the stopped be forfeitured and used to pay court costs and the remaining returned. Court quashes warrant. Courts: orders 30 days jail ; concurrent to his Illinois sentence and court costs. Court orders the  money held be used to pay the court costs and remaining amount be returned.  Any property held by the PCSO will be returned to whomever the Def has pick them up. Release; April 29, 2019 with good time.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 9:28
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 8, 2019 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Regions Hospital re: def remains hospitalized.
Bench Warrant

10:44 Defendant John paul Majerus not in court. Atty Rory OSullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based upon nonappearance by Mr Majerus, Court orders bench warrant. Once warrant is prepared, Court will sign. 10:45.
Booking sheet.
Preliminary hearing on December 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.

04:18 Defendant John paul Majerus in court, in custody VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ. Atty Nero appears via phone for the defendant.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Atty Nero addresses the court regarding warrants.  Thorie brings court's attention to previous warrants requests cash bond.  Court reinstates $2000 signature bond. Defendant advised to contact the PD's office or request court appointed attorney as soon as possible, preliminary hearing will not be rescheduled.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
from John Majerus II re: asking for a new date court and have time to get a lawyer started.

4:12 p.m.  Defendant John paul Majerus not in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan requesting bench warrant.  Court authorizes warrant and will sign upon presentation.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

03:43 Defendant John paul Majerus in court without counsel.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: Defendant failed to appear for preliminary hearing.  Defendant addresses the court, mixed up court dates with traffic citation from Prescott.  Thorie: quash warrant and reinstate signature bond.  Court reinstates $2000 signature bond and orders warrant quashed.  Defendant indicates that Atty Don Schwab may be representing the defendant. Set for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

4:22 Defendant John paul Majerus not in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan is requesting a bench warrant based on non appearance. Court grants request and will sign upon presentation.
Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

10:47  Defendant John paul Majerus in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not have an attorney present. Did not follow through with the public defender last time he was here.  Court wants him to talk to the public defendander today and if he does not qualifiy then do court appt attorney app. OSullivan states the officer does not appear today. Defendant moves to dismiss based on non appearance of the officer.  Court will not grant the motion due to the defendant not being prepared to proceed today since he wants to obtain the attorney.
Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Bond conditions read to the Defendant by the Court.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 3:37 Defendant John paul Majerus in court, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over address, birthdate and phone number with def.   Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. OSullinvan: $2000 signature bond. Loberg has no objection.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 10:15 am.
